comments:
Testerss name: Anthony 
Testing Language:Germany

Detail explanation of defect
1. Generate a memory analysis history record.
2. Select a created record in step 1, right "click">>"Open with">>"Memory 
statistics">>Now the "Memory Statistics" table are open
3. Select one of the object then right click and select "Show Object references"

=====================
Expected Result      
the ?Object references? view will open
=================
Actual Result
Error message pop up - "Unable to create part:Objektverweise"

Hi Antony,

We aren't changing any code in TPTP 3.3 to fix TVT defects, just the fragments
themselves, but can you please review this bugzilla and add a comment explaining
a workaround, or that's it's a limitation for this release?

Thanks,
Ruth.

This bug is assigned to the wrong person - I am not responsible for the trace
views.  Eugene could you take a look at this or assign it to the right person if
you aren't please?
C.K. Which TPTP 3.3 build are you using?

Investigate for a workaround, this is a limtation on TPTP 3.3 Germany.

colon ':' was added in Germany translation file in which colon is used as
separator token in string parsing.

Original English String
STR_REFERANDS                     = Show Reference By
STR_REFEREE                       = Show Reference To

Germany String
STR_REFERANDS                     =Anzeigen\: Verweis durch
STR_REFEREE                       =Anzeigen\: Verweis auf

If I removed the '\:' from the Germany file, the view open without the error
message.

Ruth, Do we have any translation fix available for TPTP 3.3? Would you please
target this to the correct release and pass this bug to the correct translation
team member.

The German file is under plugin 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.views
in TPTP 3.3 and TPTP 4.0

I'll remove Cam from this bugzilla because she isn't handling TPTP 3.3 translation.

Sounds like this should be a fix in the fragment, not the code, and as such this
will be fixed in TPTP 3.3. I'll move this bugzilla back to the 3.3 Version and
will assign it to the originator, who will then follow through with the translator.

C.K.Lim, can you please work with the translator to remove the colon from the
German translation?

Thanks,
Ruth.

Email notification for translation update is send at June 3 to Germany TSC for a
translation correction. Please reassign the ownership to Arno
(achrist@de.ibm.com), TSC tester, to make the PII update. 
Alex Liang

This should belong to achrist@de.ibm.com, but apparently that id can't accept
bugzillas any more? Reassigning to lsc05@tw.ibm.com.
